document.docTitle: Triplectides dawnae Malm & Johanson, 2008, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Description of eleven new Triplectides species (Trichoptera: Leptoceridae) from New Caledonia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of eleven new Triplectides species (Trichoptera: Leptoceridae) from New Caledonia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species is separated from most other New Caledonian
Triplectides
species by the presence of 4 hind tibial spurs. It is easily distinguished from
mariannae
,
nathaliae
and
wardi
by the longer mesal lobe of the inferior appendages and the shape of tergum X. It is most similar to
smithi
and
aequalichelatus
, new species , from which it is separated by the shape of tergum X, and the longer harpagones and mesal lobe of the inferior appendages.
Etymology. Named after Ms Dawn Williams, for her never-ending belief and encouragement of the senior author’s work.
